intro: Canthium pynaertii, commonly known as the African hogweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the leaf axils. Its fruits are dry, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Canthium pynaertii is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
